32768.name: A Game of the States
32768.description: A Game of States is copyrighted from 1887 by O.F. Decker M.D. Buffalo, N.Y.. The game has Geographical and Historical questions on 70 cards for a total of 700 questions. The game box states that Every question is Answered by the Name at the top of the Card. he game sold for 75 cents

32770.name: Hänsel und Gretel: Ein Märchenspiel
32770.description:
(translated: Hansel and Gretel - A Fairy Tale Game)

Probably from the 1950s.

A simple roll and move course with events from the Grimm fairy tale. The board has die-cut holes in it instead of spaces, it stays in place of the box.
On the box's edge is a short wooden lever which can be used as a stand to keep the board at a slight angle. The playing pieces are colored pottery balls which are moved from hole to hole - some holes are larger than the balls - should a die roll or an event (explained in the box's lid) bring your piece to such a hole, your ball falls through, rolls to a chute on the lower end of the board and you will have to start again. The mechanism is similar to Cat & Mice or Holes & Traps.

32771.name: Cat & Mice or Holes & Traps
32771.description:
(translated: Cat and Mice - A Fun Race)

Probably from the 1950s. A simple roll-and-move game where up to 5 players are mice (small pottery balls), trying to reach the end of a tilted course (with holes for spaces, similar to Hänsel und Gretel: Ein Märchenspiel), one player is the cat (a larger ball), allowed to move in both directions, trying to catch all mice.

The cat never can fall through the holes, the mice can (and have to start over).

The board is raised and has a track on it. Each point along the track is a hole. Some holes are bigger than others. The playing pieces are circular, like a ball.

One player is a cat, the others are mice. Everyone moves along the track by a die roll. The mice must escape from the cat player who has a big advantage. If a mouse player lands on one of the bigger holes then it will fall through the hole and out of the game. The cat playing ball is too large to fall through a hole so he doesn't mind which space he lands on.

The cat wins if all the mice are caught or the mouse who gets to the end of the track first, wins

32772.name: Kreuz und quer durch den grünen Harz
32772.description:
(translation: Cross-country through the green Harz (a mountain region in Germany))
A simple roll-and-move game, where two groups of players each take a different route through the region (both routes have the same number of spaces and share several spaces with each other). If players reach certain spaces on the board, they have to read educational texts about the cities and villages of the region.

32773.name: Bombers Aloft
32773.description:
From the rules:

There are four lanes of travel. The first spin selects the lane of travel. Player 1 spins again and sets the bomber's altitude. The nose of the bomber is placed in the metal stand provided at the height noted. A third spin gives the movement value.

The AA gun spins next (2 times to set the lane and altitude). If they match the lane and height of the bomber it is brought down. Each player follows in succession with a bomber and then the AA gun's attack. If the AA score a kill it gets points based on the zone the bomber is in and its altitude.

The lanes contain spaces with numbers (from 1 to 14) that reference the hit on the score card. The value is recorded as part of the score. Any plane that comes to a "Change Altitude" space spins the spinner for a new altitude.

The game ends when all bombers have been shot down or have reached the finish line. The player with the largest score is the winner.

32774.name: Don Pipas
32774.description: Game of tour of order. The players must avoid all the dangers and take his(her,your) gentleman to except in the castle

32775.description: I Play of order. By means of issues of dice of colors the players must lead to the tortoises to the basket of food
32775.name: Tartarugas comilonas

32776.name: The Klutz Book of Card Games: for Sharks and Others
32776.description: The Klutz Book of Card Games for Sharks & Others is the complete Klutz-proof instructions (including diagrams, photos, cartoons, blueprints, strategy, etc.) for the best 20 card games in the galaxy! From Old Maid to Gin Rummy.

32777.name: Basic Fleet Combat System
32777.description:
Basic Fleet Combat System (BFCS) is a minimalist game of starship fleet combat, with an eye to playability.

Using simple stats for ships, simple movement rules, and quick combat rules, you can fight out simple battles between any number of ships.

Use any hex paper, Dice as indicated later on in the rules, pen & paper as needed, and some type of markers to use as ships.

32778.name: Basic Starship Combat System
32778.description:
From the game's designer:

'While I enjoy Star Fleet Battles, it seems that there has been so much added to it since I first played that it is not the game that I first played. I wanted a simple, flexible game - and I wanted to add in Construction - something never in SFB. So here we are.

'I thought about several ways to add realism to the game, and while that goal is laudable, it does not always render a usable game. While some things are in the game for realism, others are in it just for fun. One goal was realistic movement of some sort. I have tried to give a CONSISTENT movement system, at least.

'I would like to have fighters as much as the next guy, but my sense of reality would not allow them to dominate Space Warfare as much as some would prefer.'

32779.name: License Plate Game
32779.description:
License Plate Game
Games On The Go Ages 4 and up.

On their cards, players write letters from the license plates of passing cars. As the cards fill up, players score points for every three letter word that they create. The strategy is in deciding where on the card to put your letters to maximize your ability to create words. (letters can not be moved once placed). Everyone works with the same letters that drive by, so this strategy is the only thing that separates the winner from the rest.

Contents: Instructions, playing cards, pencil.

32780.name: Blackbeard, Bluebeard and Redbeard
32780.description:
Blackbeard, Bluebeard and Redbeard (aka Yet Another Pirate Themed Board Game) is based on the award-winning children's song of the same name by Eric Herman and Kenn Nesbitt. Eric Herman designed the game with the same core audience in mind as his music fans (elementary school kids and their parents).

Blackbeard, Bluebeard and Redbeard is a very lightly weighted and semi-abstract "race to get the most treasure", but it also incorporates some nice Eurogame touches, including action point movement, card combinations, minimal luck and variable victory point options. As such, it is an excellent gateway game for younger players on the verge of discovering more involved games like Settlers and Tikal.

The game is designed in the low-cost tradition of (James Ernest's company), with pennies, nickels and dimes used for treasures, and tokens from other games used as the game pieces, and with a great amount of humor in the cards.

Blackbeard, Bluebeard and Redbeard is currently in playtesting and is expected to be available in 2008.

32781.name: Jack and the Beanstalk
32781.description:
Tagline: The Shaking, Quaking Action Game - Race Up the Beanstalk to Grab the Gold!

Once Upon A Time there was a little boy called Jack...

One day Jack planted a magic bean, which grew so high that it disappeared into the clouds. Jack climbed up from branch to branch. He climbed higher and higher, right up to the clouds - where he found a fearsome Giant guarding his treasure chest.........

To win you must climb the beanstalk twice to steal a Bag of Gold and a Golden Egg from under the giant's very nose!

32782.name: Bible Knows
32782.description:
The Holy Scriptures are written inside the cards with numbers. The Bible Knows cards are in order from Double 7 to Double 0.

There are 8 sets in the deck of 36 cards. The Double sets have "Bonus" points. When a player scores with a double, and connects the numbers, the player gets the regular points plus the bonus points.

You can play 150 to 1,000 points. Each player is dealt 7 cards. Whoever has the Double 7 plays first, or, if a double 5 is played first, player receives points plus bonus. The highest double goes first. If a player scores with a double you get the points plus the bonus points.

All players must quote the scripture out loud before connecting the numbers. The first player to run out of cards must say, "Bible Knows". The one who wins the hand receives all points in the other players hand except the bonus points.

32783.name: Disney's Dinosaur Aladar's Quest
32783.description: Aladar's Quest is a board game based on Disney's 2000 movie, Dinosaur. After a flaming meteor destroys much of prehistoric earth, Aladar and his friends must race to reach their new nesting grounds. Players advance by spinning a color wheel. Rock slides and attacking Carnataurs are obstacles that can set players back. The first player to reach the nesting ground is the winner.

32784.name: Russian Bank
32784.description:
Russian Bank -- also known as Crapette -- is a game played by two players with two standard decks of playing cards. Each player begins the game with a tableau four face up house cards, a 12 card reserve, and a "hand" consisting of the remainder of the cards. The first player to clear their tableau, reserve, and hand of cards onto the foundation spaces in the middle of the board is the winner. Although the rules of card placement and foundation building are similar to those of Klondike solitaire, Russian Bank allows equal access by both players to both layouts, thus adding player interaction.

Foundation spaces are built up in suit from ace to king. Houses are built down in alternating colors from king to ace.

Some moves in the game are compulsory:
-- if the top card of the reserve may be played to a foundation, that play must be made first.
-- if an available card in the houses can be played to the foundations, that play must be made.
-- if any house is empty, one must fill the space from the reserve if possible.
-- whenever the top card from the reserve is played, the next reserve card must be turned face up.

If none of the above moves are available, the player turns the top card of his hand face up and continues play. The player may play the card legally as any other card. Likewise, a player may play a cards to his opponent's waste pile if the card played matches in suit and is of a consecutive rank. Once a player has no more legal moves, his face-up hand it is discarded into the player's waste pile and his turn ends. If the hand is empty when the player needs to draw a hand card, the waste pile is turned face down to refresh the hand.

If at any time a player makes an illegal play or ignores an opportunity to make one of the compulsory plays, his opponent may stop him, point out the error, and force the proper play. The erring player then forfeits the remainder of that turn.

32785.name: War Tactics or Can Britain Be Invaded?
32785.description:
One of the oldest high level strategy games, War tactics takes place on a map containing England, Denmark, Belgium, Germany and a part of northern France.

The map is divided into a series of squares which include ports, forts towns, cities and the capitals. Units include land units, dreadnoughts, torpedo boats, cruisers, air units and subs. Each unit has a different movement pattern (for example ships - dreadnoughts, torpedo boats, cruisers all can move 1 square forward, right or left but not diagonal or backward) and the players try to capture enemy units and ultimately the enemy capital. Landing on an enemy will capture him.

Players take turns moving units and gain rewards for occupying key sites like naval bases and 1 square of the capital (out of a total of 4). Scores are gained for occupying towns, cities and naval bases. At the end of the game the player with the most points wins the game.

32786.name: Nanaimo World Championship Bathtub Race Game
32786.description:
GOOD CLEAN FUN

This lively and slightly cutthroat game for two to six players is a tongue-in-cheek, board game version of the renowned Nanaimo World Championship Bathtub Race. An original game created by Games People Played, it is hand-crafted in Nanaimo BC on BC grown and milled Lodgepole Pine.

32787.name: Game of Siege
32787.description: Published in Nuremberg around 1830 using lithography, the game features pawns moving for position on a grid overlaid with curving lines. The board folds in half and the pawns fit inside for storage. Pictured in the book Games We Play.

32788.name: Wir Zaubern Mit Buchstaben
32788.description:
A German language children's game where words are formed by placing letters in designated spaces around the board.

A (very) rough translation of the text on the box:
It's about the sound of letters and the ideas of the other players. 120 letter cards are used to develop and change words by changing or extending existing words. Children are free to practice using their imagination and vocabulary.

Original German:
Hier geht es um lauter buchstaben und viele einfälle der mitspieler.
Mit 120 buchstabenkärtchen werden wörter aufgebaut und durch ablegen immer wieder so verändert, daß andere daraus entstehen.
Kinder lassen ihrer phantasie freien raum und üben dabel spielerisch ihren wortreichtum.

32789.name: Bogoss
32789.description:
From the editor box:

"Find 6 parts of a skeleton, what an odd challenge... buy be careful of broken bones... An exchange game with phosphorescent cards so you can also play in the dark!"

Aim of the game:

Be the first to piece together 2 unbroken skeletons or 1 single broken skeleton"

The game comes with:

30 Skeleton cards (green symbols)
12 broken skeletons cards (red symbols)
2 joker

total: 44 luminous cards

32790.name: Cha·Do: Das Tee-Spiel
32790.description:
A promotional game (subtitled "The Tea Game") based on Alex Randolph's and Michael Matschoss' Enchanted Forest (this is not credited on the box or in the rules; it is obviously produced by Ravensburger though also uncredited).

Dethlefsen & Balk is a tea merchant and so the players travel over a world map where 13 small cardboard tea trees with different symbols on their underside are placed on cities connected to the tea industry.

Players may look under trees and memorize their symbol to collect cards (lying in Hamburg) with the matching symbols.

Some spaces force a player to draw an event card.

32791.name: Prison
32791.description:
An abstract game: the 13 red pins are the prisoners, 4 black pins are the wardens. Wardens (starting on each of the four corners of the 8 x 8 board) have to capture the prisoners by jumping over them - if only 3 red pins are remaining, the game is won by the warden player.

The red pins try to reach all 4 corner spaces (which is their victory condition).
A warden cannot be eliminated, but is forced to jump over a red pin, if possible.

32792.name: Army Checkers
32792.description:
The object of the game is to capture one or more enemy men between two of your men. Captures may be made along vertical, diagonal or horizontal rows of squares.

On the first turn only, the opening player player places 2 men, 1 on the start in the center of the board and 1 more adjacent. The other player must then place 2 side by side, adjacent to the first player. Each player then places a single man next to an enemy man trying to encase them between friendly men. Any enemy so encased are flipped over to the friendly side.

When maneuvers end the player with the most men showing wins.

32793.name: Infinite Chess
32793.description:
A variant form of chess played with the usual pieces on an infinity-symbol-shaped board. While the rules are nearly identical to those of standard chess, the differing topology changes the game substantially.

Website: http://www.colebank.com/ichess/index.asp LINK NO LONGER OPERABLE

32794.name: Disney Pictionary DVD Game
32794.description:
From the Publisher:

Disney Pictionary DVD Game features the classic game of quick draw, plus a DVD that will draw the clues for you! Add to that live-action clips and animation from Disney movies you've got fun for the whole family.
Ages 7 and up

Game includes DVD game disc, 120 game cards, four category cards, four drawing cards, card holder, colored die, score card and four dry-erase pens.

32795.description:
Ísland - spurningaspil (Iceland) is basically a trivia game with some economic traits, where you travel around Iceland and along the way you can buy and sell properties and build motels and hotels on those properties. Other players pay rent when they land on a property belonging to others.

If you land on a question spot, you have ten seconds to answer the question (six categories), getting a reward if answered correctly, or paying a penalty (money or doing something silly) if getting the answer wrong. Players decide for how long they play, whether for a set period of time or as long it takes to eliminate all the others.
32795.name: Ísland: spurningaspil

32796.name: Vogun vinnur, vogun tapar
32796.description:
This trivia game is based on a popular radio quiz show from the late fifties, aired on the National Broadcasting Corporation of Iceland. The game comes with ten envelopes (categories) containing 20 questions each, with categories like arithmetic puzzles, literature, who advertises like this?, the bible, old Norse religion and more. Also included is a booklet with the answers.

There are two ways to play the game, Double or nothing (where you get 4, 8, 16, 32 or 64 points if you answer the five questions from chosen categorie correctly, or zero points if you answer incorrectly). Another way is Who knows what? where you mix the questions and you get 2 points for correctly answered questions (1 point if you answer a question someone else failed to answer).

32797.name: All Fall Down
32797.description:
The exciting race game where players pieces may suddenly disappear with a "plonk".

The game board consists of two layers. The top layer has a race course with hole on each square surrounded by a plastic rim to hold upright the narrow player pawns. The bottom layer is on black card with various holes and sits inside the box. When the upper board is placed on top most squares on the race track have a solid footing for the pawns, but some have holes that allow the pawns to fall through into the box and out of the game. The boards are square so that they can be rotated in relation to each other to provide variable distribution of the holes.

Each player takes 5 pawns. The winner is the first person to get a pawn to the end of the track. Players roll the dice and move one of their pawns the distance indicated. If they have multiple pawns on the track they can chose which one to move. When a hole is discovered by a player losing their piece to it all players need to remember where it is so that they don't repeat the mistake.

32798.name: Paddelfahrt
32798.description: Players roll dice to maneuver down the river, poor rolls will trap players in a whirlpool that later rolls will allow them to escape. The pawns are little metal canoes, each with a canoeist.

32799.name: Wer hat Vorfahrt?
32799.description: Pictured in Games We Play, the players move their trucks around the board to the variable fire locations.

32800.name: The Mountain Race
32800.description: Children's game in which the pawns are racing cars designed to climb mountains, giving them something of a tractor look.

32801.name: Holiday Travels
32801.description: Roll-and-move game featuring train travel in Europe. Pictured in Games We Play.

32802.name: Swiss Travels
32802.description: Players move around Switzerland collecting tokens. Cards marked 1 through 6 are drawn determing starting positions. typical 'roll&Move' game.

32803.name: Volando Flying Roulette
32803.description: This is an odd version of roulette. A British plane which is on a counter-weighted arm is "flown" in a circle over the playing surface. Players wager on where the plane will land. Payoffs are made based on the size of the area.

32804.name: Stop!
32804.description: Pictured in Games We Play, this game involves moving your own trucks across a rural map/maze while blocking your opponents passage.

32805.name: Im Fluge durch Grossdeutschland
32805.description:
A reworking of classic games of flying around the world, but instead players just move around Germany. It came out at a time when German planes really couldn't go anywhere with a peaceful landing in mind.

Pictured in the book Games We Play.

32806.name: Bang!
32806.description:
A militaristic abstract in which players move three types of pieces: gunners, machine-gunners, and guns," on the grid lines of a checker board that is crossed with diagonal lines.

Pictured in the book Games We Play. It was one of several militaristically themed games that came out in the run up to WWII.

32807.name: Roly Poly
32807.description:
From the publisher:
A novel game with Goblins. The figures are made to jump into the perforated board.

Pictured in the book Games We Play, from the illustration, one can't figure out if the point is to get the correct hole in the board or avoid the holes in the board.

32808.name: Nansen's Nordpolfahrt
32808.description:
One of several roll-and-move games that came out between 1890 and 1910 as the public was enthralled with expeditions to the arctic.

The board features illustrations of the trip north, by ship, kayak, dogsled, and skis. The dice rolling journey covers the journey north and the return home.

The board is pictured in the book Games We Play.

32809.name: Star Hopping
32809.description: Pictured in the book Games We Play, this is a roll and move game played on two stars, one on the inside of each half of a box. It appears that players collect the tokens put out on each point of the star at the start of the game.

32810.name: Game of Nuns
32810.description: Featured in the book Games We Play as an example of an early game from Nuremberg. The game appears to be a four person game of checkers played on cross with 33 holes, and the playing pieces are pins about the size of golf tees. The board is actually the lid of a wooden box that holds the pieces. Unlike other games from this early 1800's Nuremberg period, there is a chance copies of this game exist, even in mint condition, because it looks to be all wood.

32811.name: Flora, the Flower Game
32811.description: Featured in the book Games We Play as an example of an early lithograph game published in Nuremberg, from the illustration it appears to be an early version of Tangoes, with red and blue geometric shapes that can be arranged to create "flowers."

32812.name: New Question and Answer Game
32812.description: Featured in the book Games We Play, one wonders if this was the first trivia game...but with the word New in the title perhaps it was the second. From the illustration, it appears that each lithographed card consists of one full-color humorous illustration and one question.

32813.name: Battle of Talana Hill
32813.description:
A wargame depicting the Battle of Talana Hill -- October 20, 1899.

A deck of playing cards determines who does what and when (if a red card is drawn, the British player activates one counter. If it is a black card, the Boer player activates one counter.)

Players win by obtaining more victory points than their opponent. Victory points are obtained for inflicting casualties.

32814.description:
A game for Icehouse pieces (the rules are written with the Rainbow Treehouse set in mind. If you are using the Xeno set or your own stashes, adjust the color reference accordingly. You will need one pyramid of each size of 5 different colors.)

The animals in different parts of the forest have sent teams to compete in the annual contest. Each team has a grumpy bear, an impatient fox and a nervous hare. They all race to get to the center of the board. Along the way you will have opportunities to push your opponents out of the way, pin them motionless, leap over them, swap places with them and hitch a ride with them.
32814.name: Bears, Foxes & Hares

32815.name: Miltry
32815.description: Very little is known about the game. The box describes it as "A Game of Warring Nations". The pieces are colored wooden pieces with flags of five countries attached (England, France, Germany, Austria Hungary, Russia). The game play is point to point with captures happening when there is no place to retreat to and controlled capitals are used to determine winners at the end of the game.

32816.name: Champion European War Game
32816.description:
The goal is to see which side can capture the other. Germany faces England, Belgium, France and Russia in four wars, the side that wins three battles wins the war and is the "Champion".

Each war is fought one at a time. The opponents each place a unit in the appropriate capital and play is determined by spinning the spinner. If there is a gap between units then the inner circle (movement) is used, otherwise a battle is fought and the outer ring is used.

The player that pushes the enemy army back and captures the enemy fort wins the war.

32817.description:
Players roll dice to determine which colored pieces they can activate. When activated, a player can do the following with the piece:

* Place a small piece onto your home row under your control.
* Upgrade a piece you control or one that is standing.
* Move a piece you control
* Activate a lying piece you control by standing it up.
* Activate a standing piece by downgrading it. Apply area after downgrade.
* Take control of a standing piece.

If, during play, a piece is moved over and off your opponent's side of the board, place it aside. It is out of play and counts towards your win.

The first player to have a piece of each color cross over and off your opponent’s home row wins.
32817.name: Battle Zone

32819.name: Dragon Racing
32819.description:
Players roll dice and assign rolls to Speed, Dexterity (cornering), Fire Breath and Agility (dodging). They then race through a maze with fire breathing combat possibly occurring when two dragons meet.

The Print and Play version of the game can be downloaded from http://www.mmiparchive.papermakeit.com/28%20-%20Boardgames.h...

32820.description:
From the Game Designer's Website @

http://store.canoegame.com/c-5-strut-ioriginali.aspx

Object

The object is to win the game by ridding yourself of all cards in your hand before your opponent.

Game Summary

Decide on a scorekeeper. Once the cards have been shuffled, the scorekeeper deals 3 cards face down to each player, along with an equal number of white dice, called a stash. The scorekeeper places the remaining cards face down off to one side of the table to form a deck.

The scorekeeper begins the game by rolling two dice (1 black & 1 white) in the center of the table. If no one scores, play rotates clockwise to the next player who rolls two dice. Any two die, including the black die can be rolled (see below). Before each roll players examine their cards to see what dice combinations will be needed to match a card in their hand.

Two white dice from your stash, or.
One die from your stash, and one (previously rolled) die from the table, or
Two (previously rolled) dice from the table.

Player’s take turns rolling until someone shouts STRUT! indicating a player believes they have won the round. A round is won when you match a card in your hand with a dice combination on the table. Let’s say you have a 4 of a Kind (card) in your hand. There are 8 dice on the table 1,3,4,6 and four 5’s: 5, 5, 5. You quickly shout Strut! believing your dice combination (four 5’s) matches the card (4 of a Kind) in your hand, thus winning the round. But have you? You have if one of your 5’s is the black die. The black die must always be part of the score.

Keeping score is very simple. All dice on the table are scored. The black die counts face value [1]=1 point, [2]= 2 points [3]=3 points, etc. White dice count 1 point each. In the example above, you scored a total of 12 points (5 points for the black die and 7 points for the white dice.)

After each round the winner’s points are totaled by the scorekeeper. After the scorekeeper has recorded the points, the winner discards his/her winning card, placing it “face up” under the deck. If the winner’s accumulated score totals less than 30 points then he/she must draw one new card from the deck. If the winner has accumulated 30 or more points, no card is drawn allowing that player to begin ridding his/her hand of cards in an attempt to win the game. (Re-Action cards are an exception to the “30 points” rule.) All other players keep their cards. Dice on the table are evenly redistributed. Note: As you will see as the game progresses, tactics and strategies become a big part of each round.

The winner begins the next round by rolling 1 black and 1 white die. Play continues until someone shouts Strut! The first player to accumulate 30 or more points with no cards remaining in their hand wins the game.

The Black Rooster

If an opponent throws the Black Rooster card down on your winning card, it spells disaster! You must turn in all the cards in your hand, and draw 3 replacements. Plus, you lose all your accumulated points.
32820.name: Strut!

32821.name: Battle Leader Tactics
32821.description:
Battle Leader Tactics (BLT)

From the Rules:

"Have you ever wanted to match the tactical brilliance of Napoleon versus the charismatic sheer will to succeed of Alexander the Great? Do you want to see how Caesar’s ingenuity flourishes with the use of mechanized
infantry or missiles? How about seeing Genghis Kahn flying in low over the steppes to terrorize his opponents with attack helicopters? Go into battle with some of the most feared and successful military leaders of all time. Use the same tactics they used to win their battles. Fight with the military forces revered throughout history. All this is possible with the abstract wargame--Battle Leader Tactics (BLT)."

BLT is a component and introductory game for the Battles Leaders Tactics & Technology (BLTT) master game. BLTT is an abstract wargame that depicts some of the greatest military leaders (e.g., Alexander, Napoleon, Caesar, etc.) commanding historical units in some of the world most decisive battles (e.g., Megiddo, Zama, Hastings, Waterloo, etc.) using proven tactics of history. BLT serves as a basic game introducing players to the interaction between army units, leaders and tactics. BLT allows players to command standard troops (e.g, infantry, cavalry, artillery and guard) and special military units (e.g., 300 Spartans, Panzer Army Afrika, etc.) with historic military leaders using real tactics and fog of war--all without any dice. The primary resolution engine for the game is housed in the Tactics Results Chart (TRC), which compares tactics selected by the players and determines losses, if any, of army units.

Components:

21 Leader Cards
24 Tactics Cards (12 for each player)
28 Army Cards (14 for each player)
10 Special Army Cards
1 Tactics Results Chart
1 Rules Booklet
1 Leader Card Explanation Sheet

32822.name: Cooperation: The wealth of Nations Game
32822.description:
COOPERATION: The Wealth of Nations Game is a boardgame simulating economic systems. It includes four different variants of different skill levels based on different economic systems. BARTER is the beginners' game, MAJORITY RULE is the socialist game, MAKING MONEY is the capitalist game, and AUTONOMY is the expert tournament game.

The game plays up to six players. Each player manages cities. The object of a game is to obtain basic resources for each city while employing the fewest people . Players receive points for each different resource they obtain and bonus points for citizens at leisure.

AUTONOMY simulates a futuristic possible economic system that would produce wealth for everyone with a minimum of work.

The game is based on Information Chain Theory.

In addition to existing as a boardgame, this game is downloadable as an electronic game from the publishers' website.

32823.name: Minotaur!
32823.description:
MINOTAUR! is a two-player game based on Greek Mythology.

Every year.. by the decree of King Minos.. fourteen Athenians are selected to be sacrificed to Asterion the Minotaur.. in the labyrinth at Knossos on the island of Crete.

Players take on the role of the final two Athenians trapped in the labyrinth.

MINOTAUR! features a dynamic gameboard and affords players the opportunity to take control of the minotaur.. all in an effort to be the last Athenian to survive.

32824.name: Panko or Votes for Women
32824.description:
This card game from 1910 shows pictures of events happening in the suffrage "Votes for Woman" era. I don't know much more about the game except that a copy of it is in The Jon A. Lindseth Suffrage Collection.

The card game had set of 52 cards and features Emmeline Pankhurst and Winston Churchill. The cards are purple, green, and white. The game instructions were included in the box.

32825.description:
25/28mm modern skirmish system. Rules cover infantry and vehicles. Players are intended to use about a squad each.

The game relies on a card based activation system - each character is assigned a card and activates when it is drawn. Elite characters get a second card but receive fewer actions when it comes up.

Task rolls are done with a single six-sided die and generally scale by distance. Better trained characters receive a larger bonus to their tests.

Damage is an opposed roll (damage versus strength) and can inflict death or one of several wound states. Wounds reduce movement and penalize a character on skill tests.

The morale rules are tucked away in the back of the rules, but boil down to checking morale for certain casualty-based triggers.

The rulebook does not provide a points or scenario system, though there is a system for generating squads. Wargames Journal has published at least one scenario for the game as a free PDF download.
32825.name: 5.56mm

32826.name: Ballot Bots
32826.description: You are a politician, and your position in the race depends on your ability to fund raise, advertise, debate and speak to your contingency at the right time and place. Advance your campaign, solidify your position, put yourself in the spotlight as you strategically maneuver around your opponents!

32827.name: Dubious
32827.description: du-bi-ous. (adjective) of doubtful quality or propriety; questionable. What's hotter: A fish on a grill, androgynous business women, or a fire breathing alligator? Which is more dangerous: Sky diving, a hair dryer, or a dinosaur? You and your friends make snap judgments and questionable comparisons in an attempt to earn points in an escalating betting system.

32828.name: The Really Nasty Golf Game
32828.description: There's foul play on the fairway, as you "revenge" your way to the 19th hole! Designed to bring out the worst in all players! A perfect tee shot can splash in the lake, a sumptuous drive can suddenly be "trampled" in!! It's a question of how craftily you play your "Nasty cards" to impede your opponents. Game can be played on this neat nine-hole course at 2 levels Really, Really Nasty or the slightly less frustrating Relatively Nasty Golf Game. A riot of a game for golf nut or novice alike!

32829.name: Connecto
32829.description:
(Translated from the box in Norwegian)

A different trivia game!

What is missing in the statement?

You will be presented song lyrics, titles, rankings, quotes, sayings and abbreviations where one, two or three words are missing, depending on level of difficulty.
You do not pick categories, so general knowledge is gold.
You may win 250 000 quite fast by gambling at difficulty level 3, but arrogance might bring you down, and you may fast descent to bankruptcy if the gambler in you takes the upper hand.
You have to position yourself on the board, use tactical maneuvers and be on guard, so your opponents do not bluff when they say they want to help you. Logic is a handy tool, but will not help if you are totally blank on song lyrics. Your opponents are ready to help, but can you trust them?

The game Connecto gives you a chance to shine with knowledge you did not even know you possessed. Let yourself get carried away with song lyrics and do deep dives into logical rows of numbers.
Place countries correctly by area and refresh the sayings you thought you had forgotten.
Will you be the first player to reach 250 000?

32830.name: Race to the Fairy Castle
32830.description: Race to the Fairy Castle is a simple roll and move game from Chad Valley. The object of the game is to reach the Fairy Castle, the ultimate destination for each player, by getting past dragons, goblins, fiery serpents, wolves and The Black Knight!!

32832.name: Fun with the Pepper Family
32832.description: Fun with the Pepper Family was made by Chad Valley in the mid 1920's. The game consists of a story being read with players, on their turn, adding words in order to fill in the blanks so that the story is completed. Votes are taken on if the word fits the storyline.

32833.description:
In Banana Split, you want to complete as many ice cream orders as can, especially the valuable banana splits! To set up the game, shuffle the ice cream order deck, then reveal four cards. Shuffle the ingredient deck, and deal each player five cards, which they place behind their screens. On a turn, a player can:


Draw one card from the ingredient deck.
Take one ice cream order and play ingredients on it.
Add one or more ingredient cards to an order already in front of you.


When you play ingredients on an order, you must play exactly as many as are on the card and in the order listed, from top to bottom. When you play the final ingredient on an order, place that card aside as you'll score its point value at the end of the game. Banana split orders can't be built upon turn by turn, but must be claimed all in one go, either by playing all four ingredients at the same time or discarding one wild card ingredient. Special ingredient cards let you steal an ice cream order in progress or take an extra turn.

Once all the ice cream orders have been fulfilled, players tally their scores to see who wins.
32833.name: Banana Split

32834.name: The Cleveland Second Term Puzzle Game
32834.description: The object of the Cleveland Second Term Puzzle is to navigate wooden balls through a wood and metal maze into the “President’s room.” This game was issued during Grover Cleveland’s 1892 re-election campaign. A copy of this game is in the Susan H. Douglas Political Americana Collection.

32835.name: Pinocchio Race Game
32835.description: This simple roll and move game is probably from the early to the mid 1950's. Game comes with a die, playing pieces and a board with spaces numbered 1 to 120. The board has a couple of detours that might have to be taken on the way to the finish line.

32836.name: Le Jeu Du Dictionnaire
32836.description: This game teaches French. Each player takes a turn by using a dictionary (2 are included in the game) to pick a word based on a card that the player has drawn from a card deck. He tells it out loud, without spelling it. Anyone who can spell the word correctly wins extra points at the end of the round. The dictionary holder writes down the definition on his paper. Each player must then write the correct spelling of the word and a definition for the word. Even if the player does not know the definition of the word, he must bluff one that will be the most believable. All sheets are then turned over to the dictionary holder so that he can number them and mix them up. Then he will read each definition out loud. He is allowed to repeat them up to 3 times. Then everyone votes for the definition they think is the right one! Points are given for getting the right spelling of the word, and for every vote each player got etc. The first player to reach 40 points is declared the winner!

32837.name: Days of Empire: Rules for Wargaming the Crimean War, 1854-1856
32837.description:
These miniatures rules were designed specifically for the Crimean War period.

Days of Empire is a set of rules for 18mm wargaming. Cavalry and Infantry are represented by stands 50 of men. Artillery, Engineers and Staff are represented by stands of 10 men. An artillery gun model represents two actual guns.

boardgamehonor.21224: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Board Game Graphics Nominee

32838.description:
From the GMT Website:

The Battle for Normandy is a game that represents the climactic campaign in Normandy from D-Day, 6 June 1944 to the first week of August 1944 at primarily battalion level. Numerous scenarios are included to play out various smaller battles in Normandy. It is intended for two players or player teams.

The game uses a unique sequence of play and a system of fire combat throughout the airdrop and beach assault phases with company-level breakdown units, then a more traditional odds-type combat approach throughout the rest of the game. Initial beach defense deployments at start and daily air support and defense allocations, hidden to the opposing player; create a level of uncertainty that makes for a tense, challenging duel.

The game combines a detailed, extensively researched order of battle with relatively fast-playing game mechanics to make it not only the largest representation of the Normandy campaign available to date, but a manageable one that is meant to be played, not shelved. Scenarios include ‘Bloody Omaha’, ‘Operation Epsom’, ‘Cobra’, ‘The Fight for Cherbourg’ and more.

A future expansion will extend the play area south, to include the Mortain and Falaise scenarios, and extend the campaign to late August and the 3rd Army breakout.

Game Equipment:

One Rule Book
One Scenario Book
Five (5) 22x34” full color Maps
Nine (9) full color counter sheets
8-1/2x11” Allied Air Allocation Log (laminated)
8-1/2x11” Axis AAA Allocation Log (laminated)
11x17” Turn Record Track
8-1/2x11” Terrain Effects Chart (x2)
8-1/2x11” Repl/Recon/Weather chart (x2)
8-1/2x11” German Record Track
8-1/2x11” Allied Record Track
8-1/2x11” Combat Results Table (x2)
Dice - 3d6 and 1d10
32838.name: The Battle for Normandy

32839.description: Each player has a squirrel with a wheelbarrow, trying to get to the island and pick up nuts that match his cards. By rolling a die, players move their squirrels and also the bridges leading to the island. When a squirrel reaches the island, it gets to pick up nuts from the tree. After picking up a maximum of two nuts the squirrel has to run back home to store the nuts. First player to collect five nuts that match his cards wins.
32839.name: Kipin Kapin Kurre

32840.name: Gotcher
32840.description: The gameboard is made of molded plastic and consists of raised islands connected by a series of raised paths. Some paths allow two-way traffic; other only allow one-way traffic. Players choose to be either hunters or fugitives. The object for the fugitives is to make their way across the gameboard. The hunters are trying to capture the fugitives before they make their objective. In turn, the players advance one of their pawns the number of spaces generated by a Traka (q.v.), an electronic number generator that comes packaged with the game,

32841.name: Traka
32841.description: An electronic number generator that comes packaged with sixteen games designed for it. The device has eight light-emitting diodes, numbered one through eight, which flash one at a time. The operator of the device presses a button to freeze the flashing to generate a number. A switch can alter the speed of the flashing to either fast or slow.

32842.name: Pro Patrica! Rules for Wargaming in the Age of Napoleon
32842.description:
These miniatures rules were designed to be both simple and realistic.

Pro Patrica! is a set of rules for 15mm and 25/28mm wargaming. Cavalry and Infantry are represented by stands 50 of men. Artillery, Engineers and Staff are represented by stands of 10 men. An artillery gun model represents two actual guns.

32843.name: Pro Gloria! Rules for Wargaming in the 18th century
32843.description:
These miniatures rules were designed to be both simple and realistic.

Pro Gloria! is a set of rules for 15mm abd 25/28mm wargaming. Cavalry and Infantry are represented by stands 50 of men. Artillery, Engineers and Staff are represented by stands of 10 men. An artillery gun model represents two actual guns.

32844.name: Days of Glory: Rules for Wargaming the American Civil War
32844.description:
These miniatures rules were designed specifically for the American Civil War period.

Days of Glory is a set of rules for 15mm wargaming at the regimental scale. Cavalry and Infantry stands represent 50 men each. Artillery, Engineers and Staff stand represent 10 men each. An artillery gun represents two actual guns.

32845.name: Days of Iron: Rules for Wargaming the Franco-Prussian War
32845.description:
These miniatures rules were designed specifically for the Franco Prussian War period.

Days of Iron is a set of rules for 15mm wargaming at the regimental scale. Cavalry and Infantry stands represent 50 men each. Artillery, Engineers, and Staff stands represent 10 men each. An artillery gun model represents three actual guns.

32846.name: Spokaneopoly
32846.description:
Spokaneopoly is a clone of Monopoly set in the city of Spokane Washington. The game board locations are businesses and attractions from the city.

From the publisher: Welcome to a Spokaneopoly, the game of financial domination, As a player, you will become a major part of the entrepreneurial system of our fiscal community, buying, selling and trading well-known businesses and local landmarks. Spokaneopoly emphasizes the allegiance and true spirit that make this community so wonderful. Included in this game are some of the finest and most celebrated businesses, attractions and sites throughout the area.

32847.name: Cannonball Charlie
32847.description:
Players spin to see what type of plastic brick to add to the wall being built in front of Charlie, who patiently bides his time in the shaft of an elastic-band loaded cannon. When a certain weight threshold is exceeded, the elastic band trigger is released, propelling Charlie into the wall and eliminating the player who caused this to occur from the game.

The remaining players reset the cannon, replace Charlie & rebuild the wall from scratch, again trying to prevent Charlie from crashing into and collapsing the wall.

The last player remaining is the winner.

32848.name: Subdoku
32848.description:
Subdoku takes the battleship game into a new dimension!
Nine pawns in three different colors. You can't place pawns of the same color in the same square, row or column.
With those Sudoku rules the battle become smarter and much more strategic then ever before. The battle of mind starts here…

32849.name: Cat in The Hat:  I Can do that!

boardgameimplementation.76670: The Cat in the Hat I Can Do That! Card Game

32849.description:
From the Press Release:

The high-energy game that combines balancing, jumping, sliding, giggling and more to celebrate your child’s “I Can Do That!” attitude!

The Cat in the Hat has come for a visit and he wants to see all the things that you can do!

Start by flipping over three cards to discover your new challenge. What will it be? Can you jump up and down…while holding the fish…under your chin? Can you limbo under the trick-a-ma-stick…while balancing the boat…on your stomach? If you think you can, shout, “I Can Do That!”

There are hundreds of hilarious possibilities. The player who earns the most stars wins!

The Cat in the Hat – I Can Do That! Game brings to life the beloved Dr. Seuss book giving kids a new and incredibly fun way to experience this classic Dr. Seuss story.

32850.name: Horton Hears a Who! You to the Rescue!

boardgameversion.222242: I Can Do That first edition

32850.description:
Horton Hears a Who! - You to the Rescue!
The jump-up-and-go silly search game!

Go on a wild adventure to save the Whos! Put on the Horton hat and race around the house to find the clovers where the tiny Whos live. Pick them up with your trunk—then hurry back before time runs out! The player who rescues the most Whos is the winner!

Horton Hears a Who! – You to the Rescue! brings the classic Dr. Seuss book to life, giving kids a whole new incredibly fun way to experience this favorite Dr. Seuss story.

32851.description:
The game of team-work, singing and surprising sleigh-rides!

The Grinch is out to steal the Whos’ gifts—but your family can save the day. Only your singing will warm the Grinch’s heart and bring his sleigh full of stolen gifts speeding down Mt. Crumpit and back to Who-ville!

Collect Who tiles and gifts with each player’s turn. But watch out—draw the wrong tile and the Grinch will steal the gifts back! When that happens, team up with your family or friends: If you sing LONG ENOUGH and LOUD ENOUGH, the Electronic Singing Detector will hear your singing and actually launch the sleigh on its wild ride down Mt. Crumpit! Connect all 12 Who Tiles plus matching gifts, and you win!

boardgameversion.88883: I Can Do That Games Edition

32851.name: The Grinch: Sing Your Heart Out!

32852.name: Star Sight:  Sic Itur Ad Astra
32852.description:
Star Sight: Sic Itur Ad Astra is a space exploration and conquest game played on an enormous hexagonal array of triangles. Players gain points for building ships, creating space colonies, destroying opponents' units, and delivering cargo. The player with the most points after a predetermined number of turns is the winner.

Players command their fleet by simultaneously entering commands for their ships into logbooks, which are then revealed and adjudicated.

32853.description:
All the sheep ran away to the meadow; the players compete with each other to bring back the most sheep to the pen and try to stop the other players from doing the same.
In this fast card game each player tries to get rid of all his cards and especially of the black-sheep card. If that doesn't work, 3 black sheep can win the game!

Currently published only in Hebrew, in Israel.
32853.name: Black Sheep

32854.name: Spell a Spell
32854.description:
This game will determine who the most powerful wizard is. You cast your spell using magic letters, spell words, and spell cards.
Creativity, quick thinking and imagination create a challenging game for the whole family.
The winner is the wizard that left untouched while all the other wizards are turned into bewitched wizards.

32855.description:
Thieves have penetrated into building where a unique diamond exhibition is displayed.
Player has to identify those thieves and catch them in the act.
Sharp mind and quick reflexes will help you beat your opponents in this crazy card game.
32855.name: Hands Up!

32856.name: Flips & Flops
32856.description: Use your wits, guts and drop of luck on your way to the gold, in this exciting memory game. You will advance along the track by flipping the jumping cards. jumping over an opponent will send him back. Try to avoid the crocodile cards and be the first to reach the end of the track, pick the gold medal and win the game.

32858.name: World Cup Cricket
32858.description:
Players represent the batting and fielding sides in a game of limited overs cricket.
The fielding player sets up his field using white counters to depict his fielders. Counters also represent the batsman and umpires, though these are static.
For each ball in an over, a card is drawn from the deck to represent the outcome of that bowl (no ball, howzat etc.), and the result is recorded in an authentically detailed score book - meaning that at the end of the innings the scores will be represented as in a real match. The positioning of the field affects the likelihood of the batsmen being given out as well as the number of runs they will score.
The box includes: Game board, with all the major fielding positions marked; counters to represent fielders, batsmen and umpires (including several spares); a deck of cards for drawing each ball of the over; An in/out die (green and red sides); A fully authentic cricket score book; four blank cards for replacement/original outcomes.

32859.name: InQuest Board Game
32859.description:
From the publisher:
InQuest Board Game is an exciting interactive, competitive and challenging game of fun, crime, mystery, forensics and law. For 2 to 8 players. You can win by answering questions in six informative categories at three levels of complexity. “No crimes to solve and no clues to track.” Show off your social and observational skills by answering questions yourself, or ask someone for help… but will they tell you the truth? Are they really your friends?

32860.name: Master of Television
32860.description:
From the publisher homepage:

MASTER OF TELEVISION
This is the perfect board game about the box! So turn off the telly and turn on the fun in this fast-paced game, where your knowledge of the biggest and the best series of Television are at stake. Stop fighting about the remote control – Fight to become the Master of Television.

Background
THE ULTIMATE TRIVIA GAME FOR EVERYONE WHO LOVES TELEVISION.
In MASTER OF TELEVISION it’s all about how well you know the famous series of the television – You have to know a little about a lot – From "Friends" to "Big Brother". From "McCloud" to "The Eurovision Song Contest", everything can show up on your "screen".
You play to become MASTER OF TELEVISION. The 8 categories cover Drama, Comedy, Shows, even gossip, scandals, strange TV-facts and much much more.
At the very end it comes down to a memorable Quote from a famous TV Series – Who said it and in what series.
MASTER OF TELEVISION is fun, exiting, entertaining and you can never predict how it ends.
MASTER OF TELEVISION can be played by everyone – age is no limitation.

Gameplay
Just like any good night in front of the television MASTER OF TELEVISION entertains from the moment you open the box. You’re ready to play right away, without complicated rules or introductions. You simply play your way through 7 of the 8 categories and when you’ve gathered 7 "Flat Screens", you’re going to face the final question – Recognizing a quote from a TV series and you have to tell your fellow players which TV Quote originated from what TV Series. Then you’ve earned the title MASTER OF TELEVISION.
MASTER OF TELEVISION guarantee you the best TV night without TV.

MASTER OF TELEVISION is the second game in a series of games with the title "Master of….". Next games will be "Master of Music" and "Master of Sports" – More to come…

32862.name: Command Horizon
32862.description:
Set in the 26th Century, the Command Horizon universe offers the chance to collect armies from the various powers, factions, companies, mercenaries and pirates that all compete for power and resources in Human Space.

Thus far, Man has found himself alone in his corner of the Galaxy, but it is only a matter of time before he meets other races whose technological development may equal or even surpass his own.

32863.description:
Quelf Jr. is a game of totally silly nonsensical fun for kids and families!

As you race through the FlapDoodle factory, you’ll use your creativity and imagination to answer crazy questions and do silly stunts. Along the way you might run into to a cranky old man named Mr. SourFace! He’ll try to slow you down. But, if you land on a Ms. Goody Gumdrops space, you’ll get help to move ahead. The first person to make it through the FlapDoodle factory wins, but everyone has fun along the way!

Card example: "Take off your shoes and socks and pretend that your big toes are named Gus and Earl. Make them talk to each other about potato chips."

Reimplements

Quelf for the younger crowd
32863.name: Quelf Jr.

32864.description:
From the box lid:

Track down arch criminals with America's #1 detective.

Meet up with some of the most famous villains in comic strip history. FLATTOP... MOLE... MUMBLES... PRUNEFACE... VITAMIN FLINTHEART... THE BROW... SHAKEY... LITTLEFACE. Go after them all.

Start from HQ and track 'em down one by one...go in and out of hiding places...pick up cards trying to get 4 that match. There may be some dangers along the way, so watch out. The first player to get 4 matching Criminal Cards and enter that criminal's hideout with those cards wins the game.
32864.name: Dick Tracy: A "Sunday Funnies" Game

32865.name: Monte Carlo
32865.description: Thirty-six tiles numbered one through nine of four colors are dealt to the players. Each player has twelve chips to use to make bids based on which the players will play combination of tiles. As combinations are made, the players receive their rewards. The first player to score a predetermined number of chips is the winner.

32867.name: Pondusspillet
32867.description:
Pondusspillet is a game based on the Norwegian comic strip with the same name, made by Frode Øverli.

The game is a trivia game with a wide range of questions, but mainly from English football, Pondus' main interest. Although the questions can be very hard, they are made easier by leaving the player only two alternatives.

It is also possible to "tackle" a player by answering questions on his or her behalf.

Contents:
- Game board
- 4 playing pieces
- 2 dice
- 240 trivia cards

32868.name: Holy Hack: Hacking by the Book Second Edition
32868.description:
From the rulebook: "Revised and expanded to include warfare in The Near East, Egypt and Africa in Old Testament Times. Includes general orders of battle, tactics, formations, revised casualty calculation method, diagrams, naval & siege rules, Divine Intervention, heroic challenges & Q.R.S.

"Originally published as `Holy Hack: Hacking By the Book Biblical Warfare.'"

This rulebook also features enhanced graphics throughout including color illustrations of examples using photographs of miniatures in play.

For support online, see http://www.classicalhack.com

32869.name: Inside the Armor
32869.description:
A game about damage control inside warships in WWII. This Playtest Kit simulates combat aboard the USS Johnston DD-557, a Fletcher class destroyer which sank by gunfire off Samar in late 1944.

It's a two-player game: one player controls the ship, and the other controls all threats to the ship.

Players must weigh relative risks constantly. For the US player, in charge of the ship, it's about triage. For the IJ player trying to sink the ship, it's about trying to construct deadly combinations.

Playtest kit is available here:

UPDATED 5/26/2017

1) Game board: https://goo.gl/h2cZDg

2) Rules etc: https://goo.gl/37xY0B

3) Example of play: https://goo.gl/J0S91J

All feedback welcome.

Cheers,
Jonathan Tristram Miller

32870.name: Avista Pro
32870.description:
Avista Pro is a sister game to Avista. Players try to find out a word matching the conditions on cards. First card gives a subject and second card gives initial letter for the word.

Avista Pro uses more difficult subjects than Avista. They are further divided into three difficulty levels: easy, moderate, and difficult.

32871.name: The Backyardigans Game
32871.description:
(From Game Box)

Make imaginative play and important part of each day. The Backyardigans Game lets kids sail on a Pirate Adventure or blast off on a Mission to Mars with their favorite pretend friends, Pablo, Uniqua, Tyrone, Tasha and Austin!

As they play kids will practice:

Color Matching
Picture Matching
Taking Turns

32872.description:
In July 1919, General Yudenich was made Commander-in-chief of the Northwestern army of the Whites, and was recognized by Kolchak as his representative. In August, with the aid of England and Esthonia, the Russian “Northwestern Government” was established. Yudenich’s planned Fall offensive was timed to coincide with the pinnacle of the White’s success, as Denikin approached Orel and Tula, the munitions-manufacturing center. From there it was only a short distance to Moscow. Heroic Frenzy covers the battle for Petrograd during this time.

The map scale is about 3-3.5 miles per hex. Each aircraft unit represents one aircraft, each tank unit equals one AFV (armored fighting vehicles), and each armor car unit represents three armor cars. White units are brigades (X), battalions (II). Red units are brigades (X). A game turn represents two days.
32872.name: Heroic Frenzy: Petrograd 1919

32874.name: Crossword
32874.description: Koplow's Crossword game consists of seven dice showing a variety of letters or blanks (wild letters) in two colors. On his turn a player rolls all seven dice, then makes words with the letters, crossword style, within an agreed upon time limit. Scoring is one point per letter used, however any complete word made using only one letter color scores two points per letter.

32875.name: Euro-game
32875.description: The goal of of the game is to let people get acquainted with the new European currency, the Euro. The game is a roll-and-move game with questions and answers and chance, option and assignment cards. You win by getting a complete series of Euro-coins and notes.

32876.description:
From the rules (translated):
Professor Eisstein has invented the best penguin-food ever. Unfortunately, the absent-minded Professor has accidentally lost his new food pellets on ice floes in the sea.
Can you help the Professor to find all the food pellets and feed the penguins?

As the name implies, this is a simplified, kiddy-friendly version of Knizia's classic Ingenious.
Whilst the tile placement rules are largely unchanged, players score by collecting penguin food chits and "feeding" them to their penguins.
32876.name: Einfach Genial Junior

32877.name: Boy Scout Game
32877.description:
This roll-and-move game is set in a Boy Scout camp and the surrounding farmground. One imagines it was either published in the first half of 1914, before WWI broke out, or had very limited sales.
Each player starts on his/her own (coloured)route; ending on a marked space follow instructions; first player entering the centre (camp of tents) is the winner.

32878.name: With Rucksack and Guitar
32878.description:
This roll-and-move game features hikers, who carry their guitar, flute, and rucksack, walking past the lakes, through the fields, and over the hills of Germany. The pawns match the art on the box, complete with lederhosen.

The date of publication is pinned at "around 1925" in the Spears history, Games We Play.

32879.name: Car Racing
32879.description:
A racing game were each player has to playing pieces. One is the mechanic that you move around building your car and finding replacement parts as the game goes on. There are many various parts so each player gets his own custom made car, with different abilities ad weaknesses.

The other piece is a sand timer, that is used to represent your car on the race track. On a players turn, he choses whether he wants to move his mechanic or car, but when then sand has run out in the sand timer, the car is out of gas and you need to move the mechanic to refill the car.

The race track has various hazards and shortcut, that may or may not interfere with your car, depending on what custom parts your car is made up of. You might want to move the mechanic around to find you better car parts, but in the end it is the player who first reaches the finish line with his car who wins.

boardgamehonor.9216: 2007 Årets Spil Best Family Game Winner

32880.name: Hvis du nu var...
32880.description:
A party game where the players are to guess what one of the other players would be if he was a specific object. For instance, one of the cards could read "If player X was a bike, what kind of bike would he be? A mountain bike, a racing bike, a three wheeler or a tandem?"
The other players will now simultaneously play a card stating what they think, and points will be awarded only to the players who think alike the majority.

Awards

2007 Årets Familiespil, Family Game of the Year Denmark

32881.description:
Villers-Bocage is a source book for Flames of War covering the battles over this French crossroads town from 12-16 June 1944.

It includes army lists for the forces that fought the battles, including the 101 Schwere SS-Panzerabteilung (Tiger Battalion), The Panzer Lehr division and the British 7th Armored Division. It also includes three historical scenarios that can be played individually or linked into a mini-campaign. The scenarios include historical orders of battle, but also include suggestions for running them with alternate forces.

Basic painting guides and historical background are included as well.
32881.name: Flames of War: Villers-Bocage

11168.name: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

32882.name: Ab auf die Insel
32882.description:
Get onto the island:

Finally, the sun is shining nice and brightly and the swimming pool in the garden is inviting you to enjoy some splashing around. As today was really strenuous, you'd prefer to lie down on your inflatable super cool palm island in the swimming pool, together with your two friends, and just float around. Unfortunately, your other family members have the same idea. But since there's only one air mattress, the turmoil starts right at the edge of the pool. Everyone wants to get to the air mattress first, since he who comes last goes empty handed.

Contents:

1 Game board

1 Die

12 game pieces

32883.name: Lost in Space
32883.description:
Creatures from another planet are lost in space. We have to take them home, using observation and grid references. An excellent introduction to using maps.

(From inside the box)

Lost in Space: A map reference game for any number of players

The six collecting boards form the plan of Fantasia. Each board is divided into nine grid squares, so that there are 54 grid squares in all. Each of the 54 picture cards shows, larger and more clearly, a creature from one of the grid squares, and on the back of the card the appropriate grid reference is shown.
The aim of the game is to match the creatures to the grid squares, either through observation or by using the grid references.

The attractive design of this game belies the degree of observational skill required. It reflects the difficulty of reading real maps and quickly teaches the value and simplicity of grid references.

32884.description:
Four young gardeners have a communal garden in which each sets out to plant a row of flowers However, that can be a complicated undertaking; sometimes the bed a gardener chooses is already planted or is reserved for a different color of flower.

Each player chooses a color peg and takes 8 flowers, two of each color. The players take turns rolling the die and moving their pegs in any direction he chooses but only in one direction. If a player lands on an un-planted flower bed and has a flower of the same color as the bed, he can plant his flower. But if the bed is already planted or the player does not have a flower to match the bed, he may not plant a flower. After a player moves, his turn is over.

The winner is the first play to plant all his flowers.
32884.name: Flower-garden

32885.description: A variant of Sequence that tests your knowledge of the United States 50 States and Capitals. Each card has the name of a capital with its location shown on the state. Players match the state's shape and color on the card to the same state shape and color on the board, then place a chip on that space. Five chips in a row form a Sequence which is the object to winning the game.
32885.name: Sequence: States & Capitals

32886.name: Hund och Katt
32886.description:
Swedish game for children.

The dogs take on the cats in the back alleys. One player takes control of the dogs (six of them), the other the cats (equal amount). The players then take turns rolling the dice, moving their animals across the board. If your animal finishes its move on top of one of the opponent's you have won that fight and the loser is removed from play.

Whoever gets his animals knocked out first loses.

32887.name: Suomalainen Yleisurheilutietopeli
32887.description: A unique game full of sports trivia. Produced in cooperation with the national federation Finnish Athletics. The game contains hundreds of questions regarding Finnish sports heroes and events since the beginning of the Finnish independence in 1917. Includes also fabulous picture cards, in which the players try to recognise athletes and glorious moments from the history and present-day of Finnish sports. Do you know... How tall is a hurdle in men’s 110 m hurdles? And how many Olympic bronze medals did Paavo Nurmi achieve? Find out all this and much more in the awesome Sports Trivia game!

32888.name: Way to the White House
32888.description:
Two to four players compete for Electoral votes, based on their knowledge of U.S. state capitols and their luck with a spinner. Starting with the player who has the spinner, the player who correctly guesses the state associated with a given capitol city gets to mark the state with his peg. When all states are claimed, the player with the most Electoral votes (as determined by the 1927 map board) is the winner.

At the time of this game, red was the color of the Democratic party and blue was that of the Republicans (vs. the current Republican=red state, Democrat=blue state association). For the third and fourth players, the Independent (yellow) and the Prohibition (natural) parties are also included.

32889.name: Hopla Verstoppertje Spelen
32889.description:
Hopla Verstoppertje Spelen is a game for children from as old as 6 months to 4 years. For the youngest it's a game of finding Hopla (the well-known bunny) and for the older kids you can use the cards to give clues as to where Hopla might be hiding.

Hopla calls out 5 times (Hopla! Hopla! Hopla!) and needs to be found within that time. Different variants are in the game's rulebook and will be added to the website later on.

32890.name: The Animal Kingdom
32890.description:
Similar to Jungle, the forerunner of Stratego.

Each player has 13 animals, with strengths ranging from 1 to 13. The players move their animals orthogonally one space per turn and compare strengths between animals when one moves into an occupied space. The higher strength wins and captures the other animal, except in the case of the mouse (strength 1) which can capture an elephant (strength 13).

There is a set of variant cards with the game which will offer some variety to the game by granting powers.

32891.name: Spytak
32891.description: An espionage-themed game that comes packaged with a Traka (q.v.), an electronic number generator,

32892.name: Krux
32892.description:
The goal of the game is to push or pull an opponent's piece so that it lands in the central hole.

Players do not choose which pieces to move, they play in a fixed order. However, rings can be placed on the pieces to give them special move alternatives like jumping and picking up other pieces.

32893.description:
Middle East Smackdown is a 2-4 strategy board game set in the middle east. Players take control of the USA, Israel, Syria, Iran, Iraq and Lebanon for the final conflict in the middle east. Terrorism sponsored by Iran and Syria have pushed the US too far and now it is full scale war. The US and its allies are now out to conquer Iran and Syria completely. They have overwhelming technological superiority and the best trained troops in the world.

But Iran has some good defensive ground, lots of men for canon fodder, militant groups, terrorist insurgents and its most potent asset of all, the liberal politicians within the US house and senate. Can Iran manipulate the media and its liberal allies to get Congress to cut funding from the US military in order to stave off conquest and win the war? Can the US military complete the war with the forces it has in the fields if funding does get cut?

Middle East Combat Comes with:

1) 3 piece 16.5" x 31.5" full color game map.
2) 432 cut-out full color game counters on chipboard.
3) Game Rules
4) 1 Six Sided Die.
5) Resource Chart
32893.name: Middle East Smackdown

32894.name: A Bug's Life Topple Hopper 3-D Game
32894.description:
Race your ants along a path while avoiding grasshoppers, Molt and Thumper. Use grasshoppers to block your opponents.
Be the first to reach the end and topple Hopper.

32895.description: Help Pooh and his friends climb the wobbly tree, but be careful. . . If the tree tips Pooh and Friends will t-t-topple! Be first to help all of your characters onto the tree to win.
32895.name: Winnie the Pooh Tip 'n' Topple Game

32896.name: Tricky Topple
32896.description: It appears to be a roll and move game with other features.

32897.name: AA Game of the Road
32897.description:
An Exciting Car Touring Game.

Start at London, tour Great Britain and be the first to return. But be careful - the road is full of hazards laid by other players! Take the fast route and meet the hazards head on, or take the slow route and collect protection cards. Which is the best route to win the game?

Object

The aim is to go around the circuit and be the first to return to London. The first player to do this is the winner. Instead of a turn, you can lay hazards for other players. When taking the longer route, you can stop at AA Service Centres and collect protection cards or take the shorter route and pass the other drivers. If you land on another player's hazard counter he hands you a hazard card. Do you have the right protection card? If not, call the AA van. When it arrives you can travel again.

Game Contents:

Game Board
5 Cars
4 AA Vans
5 Triangle Warning Signs
20 Hazard Counters
25 Hazard Cards
20 Protection Cards
1 Die
Rules

32898.description: Slask 1939 (Silesia 1939) depicts the battle taking part in southwestern Poland during the 1939 invasion.
32898.name: Śląsk 1939

32899.description: In this game, the players are acting as soccer managers, trying to complete your team in the best way, and also trying not lose points because another soccer team's actions.
32899.name: Bolsão de Craques

32900.name: Grab-A-Tiger
32900.description: This is a game where you have a spinner that tells you the color of the tiger's tail you have to grab. You grab it with something almost identical to a plastic clothes pin. The game is played in 3 rounds with the person catching the most tigers winning each round and 2 out of 3 rounds being the win.

32901.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Prawo Dżungli is a non-authorized version of Jungle Speed/Arriba!.




In Prawo Dżungli (which means "Jungle Law"), players must get rid of all their cards as fast as possible. Each turn, each player reveals one of their cards as a simultaneous action. If two or more cards are identical, their owners try to catch the "sceptre" as fast as possible. The fastest player then gives their card to one of the opponents. But if an incorrect person touches the sceptre they must take cards from other players.
32901.name: Prawo Dżungli

32902.name: SQR
32902.description:
SQR Base is a turn-based strategy game for one or two players.

The game is played on a board made of square cells (though the board itself needn't be square). Each player will make a team of characters, the SQRs, to face an opponent. The object of the game can be either moving one or several neutral characters to a special cell, the Base (different for each player), defeating all the opponent's SQRs or conquering the opponent's Base.

32903.name: Mickey Mouse Don't Wake the Dragon Game
32903.description:
Each player takes turns to win charm cards & the player with the strongest charm wins the challenge, moves ahead one space or moves his opponent back one space.

The winner is the first player to save Minnie from the dragon.

Great nostalgic family fun !

Contents

1 x playing sheet
15 x Magic charm cards

4 x Playing pieces

1 x Spinner

32904.name: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Linear Guild

24157.name: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Dungeon of Dorukan

32904.description:
Get your evil twin on! This is the upcoming expansion to the Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Dungeon of Dorukan, featuring fully playable versions of villainous Nale, Sabine, Thog, and the rest.

This will be a stand-alone expansion to the The Dungeon of Dorukan and will not require the base game to play. The expansion can be combined with the base game for even more gameplay options!

Rich Burlew basically announced that he had an illness that limited his health to the point that he had to devote all of his time to the comic (and the collection of said comics into books.) As he does the art for the game (and created the Order of the Stick world) and didn't have the time to devote to it, this expansion was put in limbo.

32905.name: Think a Dot
32905.description: In turn, a player drops a marble in any one of the three holes at the top of the device. The device contains eight flip-flops; three on the top row, two on the middle row and three on the bottom row. A flip-flop will change a window’s color from one to the other every time a marble hits it. The marble will exit the device from the left or the right. A player may continue taking a turn as long as the marble exits the device from the side chosen by that player. The object of this puzzle-game is to get a pre-determined sequence of colors to be revealed in the eight windows.

32906.name: The Game of Secession, or Sketches of the Rebellion
32906.description: The Game of Secession was produced to support the Union cause. The gameboard featured a line of numbers from 1 to 135 and pictures of people and events from the Civil War. The game was found in the Civil War Scrapbook of Andrew Dickson White, the first President of Cornell University.

32907.description:
Published in issue 77 of Vae Victis, Eylau 1807 is another installment of the Jours de Gloire series, based on a Richard H. Berg system. This time simulating the battle pitting Russians vs. French in Eastern Prussia in the dead of winter, the 8th February 1807.

Regiment-Brigade system, 200-400 infantry, 150-300 cavalry or 2-4 cannon per Strength Point.

As with all Vae Victis games, the counters need to be cut out and mounted. The rules are entirely in French, although translations are available online.

SYSTEM: Jours de Gloire Series (JDG)
- scale = 297 m/hex;
- time = 75 min/GT;
- strength = 200 men/SP.
32907.name: Eylau 1807

32908.description:
With the race for supremacy becoming ever more desperate in a world driven by the war machine: with extremist views becoming the mainstay and with the political system being domineered by tyrannical warmongers, the time has come for...TERROR TACTICS!

No longer do bureaucrats endlessly try in vain to foster peace treaties between opposing factions. Instead they too have picked up their arms and having lost heart, fight for the ultimate stake – their own survival.

Where will this struggle end? Who will become the dominant power? The world's fate is in your hands!

DESCRIPTION

Terror Tactics is a 20 card second generation expansion to the Risk 2210 AD universe designed for use either in place of one of the five original command decks or through the introduction of an additional command token.

Expands:


Risk 2210 A.D.
32908.name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Terror Tactics Command Deck

32909.name: Quick! Put the kettle on
32909.description:
This is a Snakes & Ladders-like game designed by cartoonist Simone Lia, themed around some of the recurring characters from her comic strips.

From the instructions:
